reviewText:
I usually avoid Hack & Slash games, but Bastion is special.

Instead of drowning you in endless grind, the designers kept it short & sweet. This allows story to actively drive the game all the way through, rather than merely serving as punctuation. The smooth, standout narration deserves your careful ear, as its backstory adds so much depth to the overall experience. Bastion is one of the few games which enticed me to seek out other's analysis on its themes and philosophy afterwards.

The cartoonish, hand painted world blends together to defy the sterile, methodical aesthetic many isometric games suffer. It's cute how these gorgeous tiles and assets fancifully fall into place just a few steps ahead of you, all in theme with the recollective nature of the story. The only jarring result of Bastion's isometry is you can only move in 8 directions; not granularly. However, the important thing is weapon aiming is granular.

I won't lie, there were times I found the combat frustrating, but it did improve as I levelled (and equipped) up, and by the end, I was even enjoyed it. I also appreciated the fact that you have a good old fashioned hunk o' metal shield. As in, one you have to actively face the enemy and raise to counter with. The combat is definitely more interesting for that decision.

Besides, Bastion is worth it for the music alone.

reviewText:
Bastion is a astonishing game where all the pieces from the game come together to make a work of art. There are a great amount of aspects of this game that I liked and very few that I didnt like about the game. Last year I had a huge discussion if this game was worth playing, check it out  HERE!

I'll start off listing the positives:
+ Immersive story.
+ Colorful level design.
+ Narration is what bring this game to life.
+ Sound track fits the game great.
+ Never a dull moment when playing.


Here are some negatives that come to mind:
- Alt+TAB gave me some minor problems.
- Kinda awkward to use with a keyboard.
- Short stroy like 6 hours long if you do the bare minimum.

Overall this game is a work of art and I  do  recommend it to anyone.
My Rating: ★★★★☆

reviewText:
Bastion is one of my favorite games in recent years. It also might be my #1 Indie game. Although there may not be anything completely original in this title, the way the game is presented feels different from the majority of games I've played. They keep a lot of tried and true mechanics (e.g. upgradable weapons and character, multiple levels categorized by zones, home base where you will upgrade and customize your character, and unlockable arena battles to test your skills) but they've added plenty of charm and character to this title that keep it fresh.

The narrator is one of the most memorable parts of the game and you will learn most of the world's lore and story progression via his soothing voice. The controls are very tight and almost perfect. The way you can alter your difficulty with the idols you unlock is also a nice feature that forces you to adjust your fighting technique if you want to face these self-imposed challenges. I finished the game several months ago for the 5th time, but keep reminiscing about the music, weapon loadout and the final, tough-as-nails dream challenge.

9.5/10

reviewText:
This game is excellent, some people may say it´s pretty short but i think it´s durability is balanced enough for the plot.
Talking about the plot, it was so good, a good idea, filled with awesome characters and a lot of changes around the story.
The art style is neat, all the platforms appearing out of nowhere are something I liked, but the entire post apocaliptic- half modern half medieval- wild like style really got me into loving the concept.
Something that really got me was the sound production,  the narrator´s voice was so intense and so captivating, the same goes for the OST. It is a real master piece.
The gameplay had it´s good parts and bad parts, but mostly good ones.
It´s worth it´s money.Trully charmed by this game.

reviewText:
Pretty damn amazing.

If you're on the fence about this game and for some reason are reading my review, buy it.

This game has an innovative, somewhat interactive, narrator who reminds me of Morgan Freeman, and if that's not enough, the soundtrack is incredible. Really just an amazingly well done game. My only problem with it is that it's not longer. You can beat it with about 10 hours of gameplay if its your first time playing it, 6~ hours on your 2nd playthrough. Took me about 18 hours total to get all the achievements. Still worth every penny though.

reviewText: Bastion is a great game with a story and action RPG elements. At first, my interest level in this game was quite low--even while playing, but once you start to unlock different ugprades/perks you really start to enjoy this game. If you're playing this game for achievements, prepare to play this game roughly 2-3 times from start to finish with one of those playthroughs being end-game grindy. I wouldn't say the achievements were necessarily fun, but at least the game made it so I wasn't tearing my hair out. A small tip for those wanting to get 100% achievements: First play through unlock all that is possible in normal mode. The next two playthroughs, you can literally speed run through the stages ignoring all enemies and items as the remaining achievements have nothing to do with them. xD.
